comment.text: This isozyme may play a role in skeletal mineralization.
A phosphate monoester + H(2)O = an alcohol + phosphate.

disease.name: Hypophosphatasia
disease.description: A metabolic bone disease characterized by defective skeletal mineralization and biochemically by deficient activity of the tissue non-specific isoenzyme of alkaline phosphatase. Four forms are distinguished, depending on the age of onset: perinatal, infantile, childhood and adult type. The perinatal form is the most severe and is almost always fatal. The adult form is mild and characterized by recurrent fractures, osteomalacia, rickets, and loss of teeth. Some cases are asymptomatic, while some patients manifest dental features without skeletal manifestations (odontohypophosphatasia).

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Hypophosphatasia childhood type
disease.description: A bone disease characterized by defective skeletal mineralization and biochemically by deficient activity of the tissue non-specific isoenzyme of alkaline phosphatase.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Hypophosphatasia infantile type
disease.description: A severe bone disease characterized by defective skeletal mineralization and biochemically by deficient activity of the tissue non-specific isoenzyme of alkaline phosphatase. Three more or less distinct types of infantile hypophosphatasia can be identified: (1) type 1 with onset in utero or in early postnatal life, craniostenosis, severe skeletal abnormalities, hypercalcemia, and death in the first year or so of life; (2) type 2 with later, more gradual development of symptoms, moderately severe 'rachitic' skeletal changes and premature loss of teeth; (3) type 3 with no symptoms, the condition being determined on routine studies.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the alkaline phosphatase family.

comment.name: ALPL
comment.text: Tissue nonspecific alkaline phosphatase gene mutations database
